title: Temple for peace and meditatoon
review: On the VAN ALLEN BELT its one of the only 3 places with the magnetic effect. 50 meters away is the SHIV TEMPLE with a super view

title: Great vibrations and divinely scenic
review: The temple is on the so called Cranks Ridge and is so very peaceful and scenic, simply divine. We get 360 degree view of the Kumaon hills from the top.

title: Famous holy place in Almora
review: Kasar Devi is a village near Almora, Uttarakhand. It is known for the Kasar Devi temple, a Devi temple, dedicated to Kasar Devi, after whom the place is also named. The temple structure dates to the 2nd century CE. Swami Vivekananda visited Kasar Devi in 1890s for meditation. Place is very nice and from top of the Mandir u wl get very nice view of the city.There was another shiv Mandir just beside the kesar devi. Inside photography is prohibited.

title: A place where you just want to stay - Peaceful and calming
review: A small hamlet ahead Almora city while on your way towards Binsar, Kasar Devi gives you positive vibes. A place that makes you stay and experience the calming surroundings. A place which lets you rejuvenate in a true sense and gives your creative mind the space where it can work at its best. Kasar Devi temple is just a 100 mtr walk from the road. Whoever goes there should always get time and experience the sunrise or the sunset from the temple cliff. The place is safe for solo women traveller as well and you can hire a two wheeler in case you plan to visit nearby places like Jageshwar, Almora or Binsar. There are small cafe cum home stays in Kasar Devi that provides you with basic food and stay at a nominal cost. When in Kasar do not forget to visit the amazing NGO called Panchachuli run for the betterment of local women and weaving in Kumaun region. The cottages run by Rudra Cafe just below the Kasar temple premises is one of the good places to stay with friendly staff and good service. Then there is Mohan’s cafe for Israeli, Italian and Chinese cuisines with a good stay. In case you do not pre book, it is suggested to take a round of the place and choose the property where you wish to stay according to your liking.

title: Tranquil with a lot of mountain and history
review: This is on way from Almora to Binsar and temple dates back to 2nd CE,on the Van Allen Belt. It offers a perfect place for meditation and a very good view of the mountains. A small stone inscription can be located here.

title: One of three temple in world
review: From below u will find temple is hard to reach, but it is not. special magnetic field is suppose to be here. However I didn't feel so even after meditating for 15 minutes. if u have time surely visit

title: The place for meditation
review: If your are a mediatator or want to take a break from your crazy life of concrete jungle then kasar devi is a place for you..silence speaks..listen to your inner voice

title: beautiful temple beautiful views
review: the drive up to kasar devi is also beautiful so is the temple and the walk up to it and the mountains around it. it all adds up to a most memorable experience.

title: Kasar Devi Temple
review: Good views from the temple. Apart from religious reasons, the place offers awesome views of mountain tops and also sunset and sunrise.

title: Peaceful place after a trek
review: This is a temple situated at a height with steep slope. If you are not into trekking you would not like the walking part to the temple. The temple is really peaceful.. and calming.

title: DIVINE, SERENE, SPIRITUAL, MAGNETIC
review: Kasar Devi Temple is located on a Hill-Top.

title: Avoidable
review: There is nothing here. We were told that the views are amazing from here but smoke from forest fire around made it impossible to have any views.

title: most beautiful views
review: this in like on top of a rift, so you have splendid views on both sides and if you go behind the temple it becomes alomst a 360 degree view... its most amazing. so beautiful and serene and calming. must go.

title: temple of Keshar Devi
review: Kasar devi is a hidden jewel in the crown of Uttarakhand, it has everything that makes it a perfect getaway for backpackers – budget friendly, accessible, no crowd, good people and beautiful landscape.Kasar devi is situated on Kashyap Hills and is known for its ancient temple .Many people come here to worship Kasar Devi.

title: Nice and calm surroundings
review: The place is about 8 Km away from Almora city. A little way to walk through steep. The temple is famous for its geographical speciality and historical importance. Infrastructure is small but view from the hill top is awesome. Morning arati will be happening daily.

title: Small temple but very peaceful
review: The devi temple situated at a mountain peak so you need to walk up or climb 100+ stairs. The temple is very small but that is the USP. It's away from hussle-bussle of city. It's a perfect place in case you want to meditation. As per the information mentioned there Swami Vivekanand came there and did meditation. Next to the temple there is another temple of Lord Shiva. You can see most of the Almora city from the peak location of this temple. Please do pay a visit.

title: Nice temple and views
review: Kasar temple is very nice and clean. It offers great views of the hills and Almora valley. A short climb from the road. The ramp allows easy walk up and down.

title: A small trek to enjoy the scenic view
review: A perfect place to witness the sunset. It’s a small trek of 10 minutes to reach the top. A small cave temple with idol of Bhagwati is enshrined. Must visit place if you are a sunset fan.

title: Kasar Devi temple
review: Kasar Devi temple is near Almora.

title: Hippie side of Almora
review: This is where the hippie paradise starts in Almora. Located on a cliff, the Temple has a lot of monkeys. The most amazing view of Almora is here. You can see the entire town from here. It is breathtaking. Amazing place for pictures.

title: Beautiful views
review: Beautiful views with good weather....in march we visited Kasar Devi temple..the way is so beautiful....

title: Viewpoint
review: On the top of a hill. Trek for 15 minutes. Very pleasant, green, cool, mystic. Temples of Kasar Devi and Golu (Shiva). Ordinary.

title: A little hike before you reach the temple
review: The temple is situated at some height. You cannot take your car to the temple. So you have to hike a bit to reach the temple. Architecturally speaking, there is nothing special about the place. View is also average. It has a history attached to it though. Check out the pics for the same.

title: Climb to see
review: Kasar Devi Temple is high on the hills...its quite a steep climb and takes about 15 mins to reach.You climb through a pine forest. The winding walkway starts from the gate on the main road.

title: Beautiful evening
review: A very beautiful clean n one of the best place to visit in Almora disttrict. Sun set view cannot b better then this place..

title: Sunset point !
review: It’s a 20-30 minutes trek towards the temple. There are two temples. This place became famous since Swami Vivekananda meditated here. The view from the top is simply amazing.

title: Temple at the Top of a hill.
review: A spiritual place where Vivekananda meditated and also a few Danish scholars. Its a hike of approx 500 feet so slightly tough. But the view and flow of air is breathtaking. Spend a few quiet moments there and pray to the Gods.

title: Very Scenic
review: This temple is on a hilltop in between Almora and Binsar. One of the must visit places in the Kumaon.

title: Quiet and scenic
review: Nice place to spend the evening and watch sunsets. A short-climb up through a cemented path. Was windy on the May evening we visited. A visit recommended.

title: Kasar devi temple
review: No words for this place. This place has magnetic powers which removes all the negative thoughts from our mind nd gives us the positive energies.This is a small temple which sits at an elevation of about 2,110 metres above the sea level and also blessed with the panaromal views of Himalayan peaks too.

title: Utter peaceful...
review: The rocks on the side hill of the temple, from where the town can be viewed is amazing.

title: Peaceful and quiet
review: This was my second visit to Kasar devi. Something about this place keeps calling me back. We spent an hour here, unfortunately for us the shiva temple was getting renovated so we were only restricted to the other temple. Not only does the place offer a breathtaking view of the mountains and valley but it also offers a peaceful vibe. Spending some quiet time here with yourself makes one so energised and refreshed that it's beyond compare. You may spot a few monkeys in the temple area so be wary of your belongings. The temple requires a light uphill walk from the parking so be prepared for that as well.

title: Peaceful temple
review: This temple requires you to take a small trek to reach the temple premises. As you enter there is a small temple of the deity called Kasar Devi. A little ahead another small trek will take you to Shiva temple which is still under construction. As you head down near the main deity you can have the beautiful view of the mountains. You can stay as long as you want and enjoy the view and tranquility.

title: If you are looking for peace - Visit Kasaar Devi
review: Kasaar Devi, a worderful and very peaceful place in Almora. You can get mental and soul peace here. Range of himalayas from kasar devi will mesmerize you and you can view it continuously. Very eye catching. Sunrise and sunset both gives a peaceful relief to yourself. Once you will be there you found that negativity inside you had gone.

title: The mystique Kassar
review: A temple standing alone at the corner of Binser..chirping birds...resonance of Bells will break the silence..Maa Kasaar will bless you ..adore you with beauties of her surroundings... A walk from Almora..Bageshwer Road is become famous melting points of Hindu culture.

title: Spectacular sunset view
review: This is our second visit to Kasar

title: kasar devi!!
review: dedicated to the goddess of the hills, to reach the temple you need to climb a series of steps which is not difficult at all. the sunset view from atop the temple is astounding . definitely a must visit.

title: Kasar Devi - Communicate with the Gods!
review: Even as you approach Kasar Devi village the beauty of the surroundings captivate you. The relatively easy climb up the hill that houses the temple, is a serene experience as you wind your way through pine and oak trees. When you approach the temple, a bright blue board announces the fact that Swami Vivekananda meditated in the solitary cave on the hill sometime in 1890 and that he almost attained Nirvana, when something prompted him that he had a larger purpose in life, that to serve humanity.

title: Wonderful place, amazing views
review: We are in love with this place. Amazing view of hills and valley from mandir. A must visit place. Be aware of monkeys. This is a beautiful place for true nature lovers.

title: Hill top Cave temple
review: This temple comes at 6 km after Almora towards Binsar. There is 10 min walking over hill to reach the temple. There is small cave and deity' idol placed inside it. From this vantage point you can have the glimpse of Almora town.

title: Temple inside a small cave
review: This temple is located at a hill top hence you need to trek for good 20 mins and is situated inside a small cave.

title: The Shakti Peeth near Binsar
review: A delight for those interested in Religion and Mythology. Swami Vivekanand meditated here and its a Shakti Peeth as well. Though not as prominent as some of the other temples, it cannot be missed. There is a small  ShivaTemple ahead of this on the hill which also you could visit - scenic and blissful

title: Almora-Ranikhet-Nainital trip
review: Almora is one of the best place to seek peace in the vacation. The place is so serene & calm. Visit once for the eternal piece of mind. Lots of intresting places to visit in and around. One can get the home made food throughout all the restaurants or eating joints with having a hole in the pocket. People are loving, cheerful & extremely honest as compared to all the hill stations or tourist places. I would love to live rest of my life there in almora.

title: Stunning View - Quiet and Peaceful
review: The view from up there is breath-taking. And the colours during sunset are awesome. There are two temples about 50 M apart one devoted to Kasar Devi and other to Lord Shiva.

title: It's got energy!!!
review: One of the high lights of our trip...

title: Temple visited by the great sages of India
review: A temple which provides inner peace.There are statues of the mother godess and lord shiva.This temple was visited by swami vivekananda and his guru ramkrishna paramhansa.You feel the vibarations of the sages here.A good place to meditade.

title: Goddess Hindu Temple
review: Its 8 Kms walk to reach this temple,the temple is dedicated to Goddess Nanda Devi

title: Nice hike
review: I took the (almost) unmarked route to hike up to the temple. It is a 700m hike and is not paved, so was quite the fun. It starts just after the last shop of the small hamlet. I came back down via the cemented track, which is an easy 300m walk.

title: Quaint and Blissful Place
review: Its a small temple on a hilltop, built over a cave and surroundings so quiet and surreal. This place is very old and mentioned in Hindu religious scriptures like Skanda Purana. Various Sages including Swami Vivekanand and Sunyata Baba performed spiritual practices here and around this place. NASA's explorations of this place, confirms its location on Van Allen Belt and the high geomagnetism of this place justifies why this is so special.

title: Peace and tranquillity at its best
review: Few steps to climb . The sound of temple bells and the whistling of woods is a heavenly feeling. A nature lover would love this place and one can sit here for an hour or so and meditate or do basic yoga. Truly refreshing.

title: Great amazing
review: View from Kasar Devi is just simply amazing.... You can't forget the view of mountains greenery after seeing from here. It is famous and many foreigners visut and stay there. One of the most beautiful places in Almora

title: Yet another Hindu temple but surrounding areas have historical importance
review: I visited this temple in September 2016 as I had heard a lot about from my friend who was posted in Almora, as this place being popular for foreign tourists.

title: Good ambience
review: This is the place where Swami Vivekananda had meditated. This is around 5 km from Almorah towards Binsar. Lot of monkeys around there but will not disturb you. One will feel good spending sometime here.

title: A place which cannot be described in words...
review: Kasar Devi is situated on a hill top, on the edge of a ridge off the Almora-Bageshwar highway on the Kaashay hills of Kumaon Himalayas. Temple, dedicated to Kasar Devi, after whom the place is also named.

title: Must visit to this temple. situated at the top of the mountain.
review: Must visit to this temple. situated at the top of the mountain. You can see whole city from the temple. Calm n peaceful place.

title: Amazing view!
review: The temple is in the middle of the forest. A nice easy walk takes you to it. The Ma Durga mandir is small and quaint. There is a path outside of it that takes you to another building. I'm not sure what all the debris were for... it looked like something had fallen and was being fixed. The atmosphere is somewhat surreal and the view of the surrounding mountains is breathtaking! A must visit.

title: Absolutely quite peaceful temple
review: Though the temple id on hill top, and climb is steep, it is a lovely climb on well laid steps or slope where elderly can climb with halts.

title: Nothing amazing
review: Its a small temple atop a hill. You need to climb up a little to reach the temple. Its an easy climb of 5-10 min. View is good from the top which is visible only if you're lucky and the sky is clear.

title: Mesmerizing Views
review: The Temple is a cave where Vivekanand also visited in the past. The view is beautiful & second to none, It has about 100 steps to climb to Kasar Devi & another 50 to climb to Shiva Temple above it. The Shiva Temple is in the making but the view is great.. Must visit.

title: A Small temple with excellent Views from top.
review: The temple is situated atop a hill and will have to walk 10-15 mins. Believe Swami Vivekananda came here for meditating. There are good positive Vibes in this place.

title: nice temple, lots of rubbish
review: nice temple and nice place, if you look away from all the rubbish, people leave there everywhere....and if you don`t mind meditating there with loud and noisy music from cd-player or radio of young desinterested people, walking round,don`t have feelings for a holy and quiet place

title: A quite short stop in the mountains
review: It is a small temple, but has a lot of history associated with it, so a nice short stop is sufficient. The temple has a cave which it covers and apparently it is where 19th century spiritual guru Swami Viveknanda meditated.

title: an enigma for NASA scientists
review: this place has been in news recently as it is one of the 3 spiritual places on the entire planet that provide picturesque beauty as well as have unprecedented , unique magnetic power that provides mental peace & triggered intrigue in even the NASA scientists who visited this temple in 2013 to study the unique phenomenon & conducting experiments to know the effects of this huge amount of magnetic energy.

title: magic place
review: Kasar Devi Temple is a magic place. When the weather is right one can see the Himalaya range. Swami Vivekananda meditated here. One can go tho the cave underneath the temple.

title: Nice temple and surroundings
review: It again takes a small trek to climb to the temple. But once you have done that, the view from the top is mesmerizing and is a photographer's delight. This is another place where ironically our mobile had the best reception (vodafone) in Binsar and helped us book our car/hotels for the next part of the trip.

title: Wonderful small-hike to a serene place
review: We have a wonderful memory of the visit to this temple especially since we had a great time sitting outside the temple complex atop the hill in shade of the trees with cool breeze blowing, clouds passing and view of the valley for an hour or two.

title: Small Picturesque Temple on a hill top
review: Over the last hundred plus years this temple has got special attention from the likes of Swami Vivekananda, Bob Dylan, George Harrison, Cat Stevens and recently NASA. The Reson: Its located in Van Allen Belt, the enormous geomagnetic field seems to have caused special rejuvenation for people who have meditated here.

title: A small Hill Top Nice Temple
review: It is a small Hill top Temple ...to reach one have to trek to hill top, once you reach the view from there is awesome..more than 125 years back in September,1890 Swami Vivekananda performed most severe forms of spiritual practice in a solitary cave of this mountain...It was really a wonderful experience to spent some time in a holy place surrounded with such beauty of Nature.

title: Place of Spiritual enlightenment
review: Some say that this the place where Swami Vivekananda received spiritual enlightenment , earlier there used to be a cave but now a temple structure stands in its place , just above it a old Shiva and  Bahirav temple also exist. The temple is situated on a hillock hence you have to walk around 80 -100 steps to reach the temple premises. The Idol of the deity is beautiful and the surroundings have essence of spirituality.

title: Must if you go to Almora or Binsar
review: Said to have strong magnetic field which helps to concentrate mind on God or in meditation.follow sign of Sharda peeth( where ladies/ mataji's of Sharda math:female equals ofRamakrishna mission : have ashram) & park your car.

title: Positive vibes, Hippie trails and a beautiful view of the sunset
review: This small temple is located at the peak of the hill and is supposedly where vivekananda had meditated here too. Also heard from locals, that there's a lot of positive energy about this place, but something that everyone experiences is a Beautiful Sunset view that is a must see no matter what...

title: Excellent sunset view
review: Besides being a temple, it offers excellent view of the valley and the sunset view is one to die for. It is photographer's delight.

title: Kasar Devi Temply
review: The temple is situated atop a hill, the climb up being fairly strenuous but worth it.  The surroundings are peaceful and so is the temple.  A must visit.

title: Bliss, Absolute Bliss
review: From the place we  stayed ,Kasaar Jungle resort,  it was a 15 min and 200 Odd ft climb. And the beauty around while climbing is breathtaking . First the Siva temple  greets you. You have to go down 39 steps from there  to reach the sanctum sanctorum of the main temple and then climb back. Religious minded or not, the experience is pleasant.

title: Beautiful Temple with Excellent Sunset Point
review: Please do visit and take blessing from Mataji and also enjoy sunset from there which is also magnificent.

title: Awesome place in whole nainital
review: One of THE BEST place in nainital...open moutain with 360 degree view...see the open beauty of place ..stay in hotel near temple..it has its own beauty

title: Binsar at a height
review: This is a great experience once you climb up the staircase. It unfolds not only a great heritage, but a quaint place where you can meditate if you wish to! The view from the temple is mind-boggling and especially in twilight, it is the best place to shoot.

title: Ancient Devi Temple
review: Kasar Devi Temple is an ancient Hindu Temple revered by a large number of people , located on top of a hill , takes about 15-20 minutes of steep cimbing. Well kept temple , has a commanding view of Almora.

title: Spiritual retreat
review: Kasar Devi is in a village 5 km from Almora.  Swami Vivekananda once came and meditated here. The temple is in amidst a forest having deodar and pine. On a clear sky one can see the panoramic view of the Himalayas.

title: Divine Atmosphere
review: The temple is dedicated to Kasar Devi and the village got its name from the goddess. The temple is at Almora-Bageshwar highway. At hill top the temple looks beautiful.

title: Peaceful hill temple
review: The ancient temple of Kasar devi and shiv.... located just between the hills and valley. It also on hill and ramp is there to go up. Very peaceful location and gives scenes awesome around the temple. There is also shiv temple further little bit up on hill, that is also peaceful and scenery.

title: Almost 2000 yr old temple
review: The Kasaar devi temple is almost 2000 yrs old. The deity Kasaar devi is inside a cave, which covers the idol. It is said that Swami Vivekanand also meditated in these caves, when he was here. The climb is a bit steep, but then, God wants his subjects to struggle a little to reach him!!

title: Serene Durga and Shiv temple
review: This is a 2000 year old kasar devi/ durga temple with a Shiv temple further up the hill. It's really peaceful and great place to sit, relax and meditate. There is a meditation room inside the Shiv temple.

title: Quiet energy & Inner Peace
review: The Kasaar Devi temple represents one of the few places left with pure but quiet energy.  Spending a few minutes there, one is completely at peace and immersed with nature.  Both the temples there are almost 2000 years old adding to the feeling of peace and nature.  The Kasaar Devi temple is on a ridge which definitely envelops you in a "quiet beautiful energy" leaving you both reflective and peaceful

title: Good point for photographers
review: Place has good view of the Almora town and the sunset. God place to spend some time alone enjoying the 360degree view of the surrounding mountains.

title: simply scenic
review: This isn't just a temple, the location where it is situated is absolutely picturesque. it is filled with so much serenity and positivity around that it instills you with faith you never knew you had. It's located on a mountain overlooking the entire Almora valley & the view of the sun set is simply awe-inspiring.

title: Peaceful
review: It was located 5 mins away from our hotel.. there is also a Shiva temple close to it.

title: Kasar Devi Temple
review: We visited this temple at the end of the day & it was a fabulous place to go. Its perched at top of a hill & you can see the entire valley & a beautiful sunset from the temple after a long flight of stairs to the temple from the road. You can take a cab & go there easily.

title: Nice for a morning treck
review: The temple was near the hotel. Went there for an early morning treck. Peaceful and quaint on the top. Nice view of the valley and nanda devi range from some points

title: A place where you feel peace
review: Though all the temples you find a great peace but here you will have a panoramic view & look like you are at the top of all.

title: Scenic location..good halt between Almora & Binsar !..
review: Kasar Devi temple is a mini detour en route Binsar sanctuary from Almora.. there are a couple of fantastically located Hotels nearby, and the area seems to have become a spot for foreigners ! (sort of a smaller Mcleodganj)

title: Amazing location
review: Amust visit temple while in Almora / Binsar. truly amazing location and views. Steep climb, carry a stick to keep the monkeys away..

title: Spiritual salvation
review: You have to sit and pray to experience the positive vibration here. All your worries dissolve. No one bothers you here and the quietness and calmness of the place makes you peaceful. Great place for meditation.

title: Good Temple With Scenic Views
review: It is a good temple just other temples in uttarakhand.

title: Jai Mata Di !!
review: Its on the height and very calm. the peace is just enough to to calm all your senses. not a place with pandits and prasad stalls. breathtaking views.

title: Temple visit
review: Relaxing temple visit.  Sit quietly and enjoy the rituals. Put the camera away to provide the sort of respect we would expect in our country.

title: do visit this temple, its a peice of our heritage
review: Kasra Devi temple is walking distance form Kalmatia Sangam resort. its atop a small hillock and offers majestic view of the valley and sunset. the temple is over 500 yrs old and again offers a divine experience.

title: Global Village in Kumaon
review: 6 Kilometres from Almora,on the Binsar forest road,It is renowned for attracting the tourist from early 60ts Hippy era . There is a ridge here which is called Cranks Ridge.Swami Vivekanand made 3 visit to Almora.From that period it become popular for Foreigner and Indian tourist.Temple is a serene spot to visit with great views of the Himalaya Mountain,surrounded by thick green forest consisting of thick cedar,oak,pine and rhododendrons trees. You can drive near the temple then need to trek to reach temple.

title: Small temple but nice to sunset view
review: Known as a must visit place around Binsar. The temple is nice and said to be 2000 years old. Must visit this temple for a breathtaking sunset view.

title: Very good view from the temple.
review: Durga Devi temple. Having a very good views of the valleys and rivers. Way from road to temple is also very neat and green. I love to visit the place again.

title: Peaceful and Scenic!
review: The temple is known for the hippie culture... however there was no trace of that in this place...the temple is on a small hillock and actually in a cave in the mountain....you have to climb up around 200 meters to reach up to the temple....the views from up there are to die for....we were there for the sunset and it was surreal....definitely visit when in almora...especially during sunrise and sunset.....!

title: Beauty, tranquility and hospitality
review: Kasar Devi Temple is a relatively unspoilt temple, and the best thing about it is that you can stay at a place that is a perfect getaway from the usual tourist circuit - INNISFREE AT HAWALBAGH. It is nit yet listed on the TrpAdvisor pages, but is the perfect place for people who love nature and spirituality. L=It is located just above the Kosi river, we went down for a swim every day in the lovely, deep pool the river forms there, and the view is gorgeous. The hosts, Julia and Lyat Singh, are the kind you dream about but rarely find, and the food is amazing. Ask for their authentic Kumaoni cuisine (ingredients sourced locally) and Julia's delicious European desserts to finish off. You can have an enjoyable scenic hike to the Kasar Devi Temple from Innisfree at Hawalbagh. The sun temple is not far either, and Jabeshwar is a short drive away. I plan to go to both these other places on my subsequent visits, soon!

title: kasar Devi
review: This temple is located at the highest point in Almora. If you have problems in climbing then, this temple is not for you. But having climbed  the hill, the view from the top is wonderful and worth all that effort. Like all temples in Kumaon, this too is a very neatly kept temple with free access.

title: Kasar Devi - a Temple with great views
review: October 2015. We stopped over at the Kasar DeviTemple on our way to Binsar from Almora. The temple is an easy and gentle uphill climb, though the elderly may find it a bit difficult to climb to the top. Once up there the surroundings are a treat to watch, specially on a clear day when the snow-peaks are clearly visible. Even if the day is not-so-clear the view otherwise is splendid. A little beyond the Kasar Devi Temple and a little higher up is the temple of Lord Shiva, A Must Visit for those travelling around Almora/Binsar/Deenapani

title: temple with a view
review: its a quiet place and the sunset from this place is really bautiful. There are not many options in and around this place so this place looked good.

title: Pleasant without being spectacular
review: A nice devotional space. If I went again I would spend more time around the temple than in it. Decent views but there are plenty of those around here.

title: Top of the Almora !!! ❤ ❤ ❤
review: On top of the Hill , This is a absolutely blissful temple where Swami vivekananda meditated , there is meditation hall just after the Nadar Devi temple.

title: Must visit!
review: Located approx. 8 km from Almora on the way to Bageshwar, this is 2000 yrs old temple of Kasar Devi. Also there is temple of Shiva nearby. You can see snow-clad peaks of Himalaya from here and also Almora. Vey near to Kalmatia Sangam Resort.

title: Great View and Peaceful
review: It is a nice walk up mountain .With temples of Kasar devi and Lord Shiva on the top.It is very peaceful and spiritual once you reach and have darshan .Small temple,clean surroundings,it has one of the best views of Almora,nice breeze.Great Experience

title: 2000 year old beautiful temple. View of Almora town from here is breathtaking. Has association with Swami Vivekananda.
review: Kasar Devi temple is one of the most beautifully located temple. On the way to this temple, we could have a very clear view of the snow clad Himalayan peaks which are normally not visible in June due to clouds.

title: temple in serene surroundings
review: Serene temple amid forest, but close to a small town called Kalimath. it has about 150 steps, which are comfortable to climb. beyond the Devi temple, there is a small shiva temple and behind that temple a sadhu stays there in a small shed

title: Heart of almora
review: The location is awesome, located on the top of a hill from where you can enjoy cool breezes and can see the view of almora city.

title: Peace
review: Peace and sanctity. One of the top most places near almora. Beautiful location. Must visit here with friends.

title: Peaceful and beautiful
review: The temple itself is perhaps not so impressive but the views on the way to it and those from the top of the hill where it is situated are definitely worth the effort of climbing up to. And besides there's an extremely hospitable sadhu living in a small hut there who treated our kids to a delicious cake (!) during our visit!

title: Kasar Devi Temple
review: Nice place to go, if you have time and you have nothing left, you can visit the temple. Kasar devi temple is popular in this area.

title: Awesome experience
review: I stayed there for two months and fully experienced the bliss of nature there,with lots of foreigners around u won't feel like ur in India anymore.Lots of gud restaurant there and u can walk for long distance without bugged by traffic.

title: Trek Temple
review: It is very near to Almora city, the temple is very old in 1890 century and its on the the foot hills of the mountains, the Kasar Devi Temple is known for Goddess Kassar Devi which has been worship during the month of November.But one has has to climb at least 500Ft" to reach the small temple,its is very famous for local villager who worship.

title: Watch the Sunset
review: The Sunset here is simply out of this world. But if you come here between October and March, you are most likely to see the Nanda Devi and the rest of the mountains soaring up into the sky. The experience is magical, and the temple offers a gentle walk along the kasar devi ridge with a lot of history and scenery.

title: Kasar Devi Temple : The view here is soulful
review: This is a very small temple located on the top of a hill. You have to climb your way up and once there you are simply going to be awestruck by the view. Best time is around an hour before sunset.

title: Sunset is great
review: It is a climb of 60 feet from the base where you leave the car. Climb further to the Shiva temple and spend the evening watching the sun going down. The serenity and calmness of the place is amazing

title: beautiful drive and fantastic view
review: Once you are in Almora you would keep thinking when we will come away from this place, taking into account the congested roads, one ways and traffic. But when you are nearing Kasar Devi it is a total change. Do't forget to get a peep into the the Eco Garden on the way. U get a joyful ride and also a view.

title: Sunset at its best
review: The temple and its surroundings.See the sunset and spend some time meditating.It a bliss. We saw many people who were meditating on a overhanging rock. Looked out of the world.The Shiv temple is also the location where Swami Vivekanand stayed and meditated.

title: Panoramic view from hill top
review: Although its a very long climb up the hill to reach here, but the experience on the top is amazing. You can actually see the entire range of Kumaon hills. There is also a short cut to climb, taking the mountain way which is not much difficult .

title: Peace Full Palace & nice view
review: Very spacial for meditation & feel a silent full Hill top.....

title: Kasardevi Temple
review: It has a beautiful location but quite a few steps before you could enjoy the surrounding beauty... be aware.

title: Kasar Devi_Highest Point
review: Worth a small trek to the Mandir. From there one can see complete Almora. Go further there is the Shiva temple.

title: Worth a quick dekko
review: lovely approach to this temple... the temple itself is scenicly situated atop of hill...quite typical of what you would find elsewhere in the hills of the north India.

title: Kasar Devi Temple
review: The view is mesmerizing and you can breathe 100% fresh non- polluted air.Small and peaceful area where Swami Vivekananda spent some time.

title: a small temple
review: its a small hike up a mountian with two temples and lots of monkeys around. the view of almora is nice from there.

title: Vivekananda meditated here
review: its an interesting place to visit... particularly since it is believed that Swami Vivekananda medidated here, which gives it a lot of historicity. its a steep climb up the hill and as a temple has nothing much to recommend. but the sight from above is beautiful. you can see the picturesque little town of Almora from there.

title: Hilltop temple
review: Nice view of snow peak himalayas, locals place of worship also excellent view of the surrounding scenery. Being on top of the mountain offered a peace ambience for being far away from the crowded atmoshphere

title: Short trip from Almora
review: Excellent short trip from Almora town. Take a cab from Almora taxi stand and get here in 1/2 hour and hike down after the visit. Apparently the temple is 2000 years old. Hike for 15 mins up from the temple for great views of the himalayas

title: Great View to watch the eagles soar
review: Kasar Devi Temple near Almora has its own myths and legends. What I appreciated most was to get behind the temple and feel the  strong winds while looking down on soaring eagles.

title: SunSet point
review: Moderate trek and a flight of stairs, Kasar Devi temple is a lovely sunset point. However, the area is very remote with very few people around. So, I am not sure about the security there after sunset.

title: Comportable Stay
review: For two days stay was comportable made by Sabu Mehra. Beside this cool & pleasent environment .Good view of the village down the hill & goog food and service without any rinkles on forehead by the staff serving there & thanks.

title: Local Diety
review: The Kasaar devi Temple is a little walk up a hill just outside the Kasaar Devi village- providing panoramic views. Beware of the monkeys though.

title: best view of almora
review: its a historical temple in almora..you need to do walk/trek to reach this temple,..temple is small and at a very scenic place..the view from this temple was awesome. must visit of almora

title: Kasar devi Temple.
review: Kasardevi Temple is situated on the ridge of the hill. The place is fully open. And beautiful view of Himalaya and sun rise and sunset ,nice views of valleys. Kasardevi Temple is 10 km. from Almora Bus station.Next to the temple there is a shivas temple too.

title: Amazing treck
review: This was a nice 30 minute trek from Kalmatia Sangam, absolutely perfect for my 3 year old. Really great view of the sunset too.

title: great view
review: Kasar temple is jest 30 minute walk form hear .no need to walk to the temple .and its a historical place more then 100 years and the place called crank,s ridge Kasar Devi is a temple on the Kashyap Hills, 7 km north from Almora, where Swami Vivekananda once came to meditate in the late 19th century. The place, got its popular name, Crank's Ridge, ever since Timothy Leary streaked on the ridge in the 1960s, when it became part of the Hippie trail, during the peak of hippie movement.nice restaurant called Rainbow Cafe and Restaurant

title: 1 HOUR DRIVE FROM WOODS RESORTS
review: A must to be a part of the day trip to Binsar Resort ...its is a gentle hike up the hill and offer great views

title: Temple at Top of Hill
review: To reach here, you are almost away form the almora town in a very quite place not hunted by many of tourists. This is definitely place for people looking for solidity. Nature has blessed this place or lets say that human has not yet encroached this place.

title: Excellent location
review: I am not aware about the history of this temple, but this place gives u good opportunity to do a small trek and excellent views from the top

title: Kasar Devi
review: Beautiful place !!!Simply superb views from temple !!!!

title: kasara devi temple in beatifull nature
review: beautiful view of entire almora city.and view of shrada math. nice trck up the hii throuh ceed forest

title: Feel of woods with divine nature...
review: To fetch this place you  need to climb the road towards Binsar. We both, me and my wife were reached Kasar Devi by our Royal Enfield. It was a very calm place and feel heavenly and need to spend a hurry less journey to feel the environment.

title: The smiling Goddess
review: Kasar Devi is about a 10 minute drive from Kalmatiya Sangam. There are two ways to approach the temple. The first that you will see when driving from Kalmatiya is a green path with just an Arch in the entrance. It's more like a Nature trek. The second path is a constructed stone path, well laid and a tad bit steep in certain areas. The trek up to the temple is about 30 minutes or less of brisk walking. The first temple you see is the Devi temple. The temple opens only after 8am but you can still catch a glimpse of the Devi through the shutters, if you go in early. She has a pleasant face and smiling eyes.

title: A perfect gateway to unwind
review: This place is situated at the top of Kasara jungle in Almora..it is a perfect gateway for those who prefer serenity and perfect  lanscape amidst the unadultered greenery with a mixture of spirituality  as Kasara devi temple was built several centuries back ....the adjoining area surrounding this temple is simply heavenly...

title: Flawless, majestic, divine, blissful
review: Kasar devi.... A place which will make

title: Excellent meditation spot
review: A slight uphill hike from the road brings you to this ancient place of worship of the Goddess Durga and Shiva where Swami Vivekananda had also meditated. Do take time to sit in the meditation room facing the Shiva temple. No crowds here.

title: best view on almora and the mountains
review: Excellent view on almora and it surrondings, easy to get with a nice short path and you'll find up there a very old durga temple and a shiva temple above !

title: A small temple
review: There is a bit of climb so elderly people should keep that in mind. go early in the morning. Car can take you pretty clost to temple but still there is a little climb which is not at all recommended in the dark.

title: Good Temple - Must Visit
review: We stayed at Kasaar Jungle Resort. This temple is a walking distance from this resort. Go from the back side of resort to temple. That is recommended.

title: Great
review: go there. very peaceful@charming temple. we enjoyed it very much. say hey to the monkeys on the way..

title: Sunset!
review: Its a lovely walk / trek and the sunset is beautiful ! Have a cuppa chai opposite the temple post that ...

title: Sunset Point without crowd
review: Small temple and historical significance linked to Swami Vivekananda. Cool breeze, divine serenity, in lap of nature that is how you can describe the beauty of this offbeat temple.

title: Spiritual shrine in the mid forest
review: Located at a distance of approximately 8 kms from almora town.connected by puckka road. This is goddesse Durga's shrine in midst of pine trees.Absolutely a peaceful picnic spot. Road further leads to binsar- another popular tourist point. You have to be careful while ascending on the walking path carved from the road as it has a leaf called 'pirul' scattered all over that make walking little bit challenging. Hold your kids as the place is full of monkey. This can be a stop over for seeking blessings and proceed further. No chemist in vicinity. No public transport. No fuel pump around.

title: peaceful..
review: Peaceful tranquil atmosphere...

title: sun set, breath taking view !
review: Don’t forget to take a short walk to Kassar Temple, ( so the cottage name ! ) walking distance from the cottage, especially in the evening, sun set is beautiful, breathtaking view, breathe the pure clean air on top of the hill where temple is situated! Panditji is available if you are lucky ! Or ring the bell of the temple number of times n he will come !! Tip him if u feel like for his quick pooja as he looks forward for it !!

title: Calm & Peaceful
review: The most calm and peaceful place on earth i have ever visited one can sit there and spend hours by just looking at the mountains and enjoy the constant cool breeze blowing across the pines.

title: Mystic mandir
review: Very special place and location. Ancient and atmospheric. Long history of special visitors including Swami Vivikenanda who meditated there.

title: Great vibrations and divinely scenic
review: The temple is on the so called Cranks Ridge and is so very peaceful and scenic, simply divine. We get 360 degree view of the Kumaon hills from the top.

title: Calm
review: The weather was foggy and drizzles together created a very mysterious background. The temple is situated at a decent height and it was close to our resort. We walked till the temple.

title: A place where you just want to stay - Peaceful and calming
review: A small hamlet ahead Almora city while on your way towards Binsar, Kasar Devi gives you positive vibes. A place that makes you stay and experience the calming surroundings. A place which lets you rejuvenate in a true sense and gives your creative mind the space where it can work at its best. Kasar Devi temple is just a 100 mtr walk from the road. Whoever goes there should always get time and experience the sunrise or the sunset from the temple cliff. The place is safe for solo women traveller as well and you can hire a two wheeler in case you plan to visit nearby places like Jageshwar, Almora or Binsar. There are small cafe cum home stays in Kasar Devi that provides you with basic food and stay at a nominal cost. When in Kasar do not forget to visit the amazing NGO called Panchachuli run for the betterment of local women and weaving in Kumaun region. The cottages run by Rudra Cafe just below the Kasar temple premises is one of the good places to stay with friendly staff and good service. Then there is Mohan’s cafe for Israeli, Italian and Chinese cuisines with a good stay. In case you do not pre book, it is suggested to take a round of the place and choose the property where you wish to stay according to your liking.

title: Temple for peace and meditatoon
review: On the VAN ALLEN BELT its one of the only 3 places with the magnetic effect. 50 meters away is the SHIV TEMPLE with a super view

title: Spiritual!
review: Within a radius of about 10 kms from Almora lies the hilltop locality of Kasar Devi. Named after the deity who presides over this hill, Kasar Devi has grown to become a sort of suburb of the main city. Sitting atop a well wooded hill and dotted with myriad lodges and guest houses, the locality is a favourite with visiting foreigners. The place has a distinct spiritual vibe boasting of an ancient hilltop temple, a Buddhist meditation centre and retreat and a Nunnery affiliated to the Ram Krishna Mission.

title: The place for meditation
review: If your are a mediatator or want to take a break from your crazy life of concrete jungle then kasar devi is a place for you..silence speaks..listen to your inner voice

title: One of three temple in world
review: From below u will find temple is hard to reach, but it is not. special magnetic field is suppose to be here. However I didn't feel so even after meditating for 15 minutes. if u have time surely visit

title: Tranquil with a lot of mountain and history
review: This is on way from Almora to Binsar and temple dates back to 2nd CE,on the Van Allen Belt. It offers a perfect place for meditation and a very good view of the mountains. A small stone inscription can be located here.

title: Famous holy place in Almora
review: Kasar Devi is a village near Almora, Uttarakhand. It is known for the Kasar Devi temple, a Devi temple, dedicated to Kasar Devi, after whom the place is also named. The temple structure dates to the 2nd century CE. Swami Vivekananda visited Kasar Devi in 1890s for meditation. Place is very nice and from top of the Mandir u wl get very nice view of the city.There was another shiv Mandir just beside the kesar devi. Inside photography is prohibited.

title: DIVINE, SERENE, SPIRITUAL, MAGNETIC
review: Kasar Devi Temple is located on a Hill-Top.
